articles.title: Arctic will see ice-free summers by 2050 as globe warms, study says - USA TODAY
articles.description: The Arctic Ocean will be ice-free in the summer within the next 30 years, which will result in "devastating consequences for the Arctic ecosystem."
articles.content:
If you think it's hot now, just wait. Heat waves are becoming more frequent globally. But how do we measure heat waves? We explain. USA TODAY Story Highlights
  • Sea ice is frozen ocean water that melts each summer, then refreezes each winter.
